title: Which companies are currently facing an Innovator's Dilemma? - Quora

response.answer_text: This is a very interesting question (I wish I could upvote the question itself).  I agree with User . You can see the signals of this happening now. Yet Apple have a bit more innovation to come which will continue to keep the value of choosing Apple in certain circumstances for a good while yet. However the ubiquity and relative low cost of Android devices over IOS and indeed PCs means that businesses like mine (melodypods.com) can find we can deliver on the wave that Ken talks about serving up services from a network centric design with a lot of benefits to clients.  Going back to the original question I think the innovators dilema is a constant that is happening across many businesses who have been around before the new mobile OS device revolution turned almost everything on it's head. From banks (eg Santander) to retail (small retail in particular with questionable developments such as Square [see Brian Roemmele 's Quora feed]) wellbeing, fitness, music, education you name it they are all at a point of a dilema over their innovation.
